Electric Motor¶

class components.motor.Motor(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

This class will create an electric motor.

Returns:ParaPy Geometry of the Electric Motor
Parameters:target_power (float) – This is the motor target power.
__show_primitives = None¶

A parameter for debugging, turns the visibility of miscellaneous parts ON/OFF

center_of_gravity[source]¶

Location of the motor center of gravity w.r.t the origin (Assumed to be in the middle of the motor body)

Returns:Location Tuple in SI meter
Return type:Point
chamfer_edges[source]¶

Rejects the line edge which will only have 2 sample_points

Returns:Edge table of circular edges of the motor-body
component_type[source]¶

An identifier to be able to lump masses together. Possible entries: ‘wing’ ‘fuselage’ ‘vt’ ‘ht’ ‘ct’ ‘boom’ ‘payload’ ‘prop’ ‘battery’ ‘electronics’

Returns:Component Type
diameter[source]¶

The outer diameter of the motor body

Returns:Diameter in SI meter
Return type:float
efficiency[source]¶

Assumed motor efficiency is at the higher-end of typical values and equal to 90% http://www.radiocontrolinfo.com/brushless-motor-efficiency/

Return type:float
extrude_direction[source]¶

Defines the extrude direction as a vector of the motor-body as well as the shaft. To access this dict use the field_names: body and shaft respectively.

Return type:dict
internal_shape[source]¶

Chamfers the edges of motor_body_import to better resemble the shape of RimFire engines

Returns:Motor ‘internal_shape’
Return type:ChamferedSolid
label[source]¶

Overwrites the inherited slot `label’ with the chosen motor_name

Return type:str
length[source]¶

The length of the motor body

Return type:Length in SI meter
Return type:float
motor_body_import[source]¶

Creates the motor body as an ExtrudedSolid in the direction specified in extrude_direction

Returns:Motor Body
Return type:ExtrudedSolid
motor_circle[source]¶

Creates the circle that is used to extrude and form the motor body

Returns:Circle used for Motor Body Extrusion
Return type:Circle
motor_selector[source]¶

An attribute which selects a motor based on input of target power. A tolerance of 10% is added to this value in order to allow the algorithm to select a slightly under-powered motor and utilize it’s burst power to meet the requirement. This can be set to zero in the code if desired with the variable ‘tolerance’ below. Finally, a condition is added to select the lightest motor from the list of available motors.

Returns:Name of the selected motor
Return type:str
power[source]¶

Pulls the corresponding field_names constant_power and burst_power from the dictionary specs. This is done to minimize the amount of characters necessary to call these parameters. Index 0 of the list is constant_power and Index 1 is burst_power.

Return type:list
shaft[source]¶

Creates the motor shaft as an ExtrudedSolid in the direction specified in extrude_direction

Returns:Motor Shaft
Return type:ExtrudedSolid
shaft_circle[source]¶

Creates the circle that is used to extrude and form the motor shaft

Returns:Circle used for Motor Shaft Extrusion
Return type:Circle
shaft_diameter[source]¶

The outer diameter of the motor shaft

Returns:Diameter in SI meter
Return type:float
shaft_length[source]¶

The protruding length of the motor shaft

Returns:Length in SI meter
Return type:float
weight[source]¶

Total mass of the motor

Returns:Mass in SI kilogram
Return type:float
